heading: SimpleMenu class
intro: This class provides methods for making menus.
description:
This class has only static methods, you can make an instance or use it statically. It has three methods in addition to the constructor.

The constructor can be used to set the application path, but you can also do this statically.

The menu() method requires a list of menu items, which you can create using the item() method. The menu() method also have a second argument which is optional: a class to add for indicating a sub menu. By default this should be the string 'submenu'.

There is also a method named CSS() which can be used to fetch the CSS generated for the menus. This method takes an optional argument which is an associative array with configuration setting for the menu. You can change font size, padding, width of each menu item and colors. You can change any number of these settings, those you don't provide will use the default value.

Here is a full list of possible configuration keys and the default values:

font-size90%
item-width8em
item-padding4px
sub-indent1em
sub-classsubmenu
normalwhite/black
hoverblack/silver
currentblack/darkgray
s_normalwhite/darkgreen
s_hoverblack/limegreen
s_currentyellow/green

Colors are provided as pairs, foreground and background, separated by a slash. You can use any color code that is valid for CSS, including hex codes like #aaffaa and rgb(80,80,255).

Note: This class does not support dropdown menus.
